item.title: [Python] [Machine learning] Understanding the decorrelation from mathematics
item.description: #1.Introduction ##(1. Purpose If you want to do machine learning, anyone can use scikit-learn etc. to implement it relatively easily. However, in order to achieve results at work or to improve your level, “I don’t really understand the background, but I got this result” I think it’s clearly weak. This time, we will focus on “correlation”**. “I’ve heard about decorrelation, why do you do it?” “How do you use it?

item.title: [Python] Python beginner publishes web application using machine learning [Part 1] Introduction
item.description: ### Purpose of this article Obstetrician and Gynecologist Tomi‘sarticle[[[Self-studypossible]LearningroadmapformachinelearningforPythonbeginners]](https://obgynai.Itriedtocreatetheroadmapmyselfbyreferringto(com/self-study-python-machine-learning/). This article is the first in a series of memo articles. For readability, the article is divided into pieces! (After writing, we will publish an article that summarizes everything) ###Self-introduction My name is Tsuba Mukku. After graduating from Kyushu University, I re-entered the National University School of Medicine. While aiming to graduate from medical school and pass the national exam of doctors, I am also learning pure mathematics and computer science (I also take classes in mathematics and information science).

item.title: [Python] Introduction to Deep Learning-Coding Preparation-

If it doesn’t work please let me know in the comments… Next article here

item.title: [Python] Prediction of horse racing: If I thought that the collection rate exceeded 100% in machine learning (Light GBM), I did it
item.description: #Thank you Note!!! This article is completely disguised I’m sorry for the person who stocked it. Thanks to @hal27 for pointing it out, thank you. ・What I did I made a fatal mistake from the scraping stage. I was going to get the data for the previous 3 races from the time of the race, but in fact I was getting the information for the latest 3 races from the scraping execution time.

item.title: [Python] A memorandum of studying and implementing deep learning
item.description: # Target audience A person who has studied machine learning and deep learning in general, but who does not know how they are related when implementing. Someone who wants to organize their mind. I will not give a detailed mathematical explanation. See the chainer tutorial for a mathematical explanation. What became a model of deep learning Deep learning was created by imitating the mechanism of information transmission in human nerve cells.

item.title: [Python] [Implementation explanation] Japanese BERT x unsupervised learning (information maximization clustering) to classify livedoor news: Google Colaboratory (PyTorch)
item.description: In this article, we will implement and explain how clustering is performed by using the Japanese version BERT in Google Colaboratory and performing unsupervised learning information maximization clustering for livedoor news. Using the Japanese version of BERT with Google Colaboratory, the content until vectorization of sentences, Information maximization clustering for unsupervised learning in MNIST About this, I have explained it in the series articles so far, so please see here first.

item.title: [Python] Simultaneous visualization of data and understanding of correlation
item.description: #Introduction When analyzing data, I think you will visualize the data using graphs. At that time, it would be convenient if the statistics showing the correlation between two variables could be displayed at the same time. Therefore, we made it possible to display the appropriate statistics on the appropriate graph according to the content of the variable (category or numerical value). Review so far I will summarize the appropriate graphing methods by content of variables and the statistics that show the correlation, which have been described so far.

item.title: [Python] [Hands-on for beginners] Kaggle's Predicting house prices is read line by line (1st part: Data reading)
item.description: # theme A job that operates a real estate system as a service, a story broke out that there is no loss in doing hands-on at the field level. That’s why we decided to challenge kaggle’s “House Price” problem, which is a famous title. So, if you make a note of this properly, it will be useful for later, so I decided to post it to qiita after reading the line by line.

item.title: [Python] The relationship between brain science and unsupervised learning. Information maximization with unsupervised learning MNIST: Google Colabratory (PyTorch)
item.description: In this article, I will explain unsupervised learning and brain science, and IIC's implementation of high performance in MNIST for unsupervised learning. The papers of interest in this article are: Invariant Information Clustering for Unsupervised Image Classification and Segmentation is. In this paper, we utilize an index called mutual information to classify handwritten digit images by unsupervised learning clustering. It is called IIC (Invariant Information Clustering). In this article, we will discuss brain science and unsupervised learning, IIC points, and implementation examples in MNIST.

item.title: [Python] [For beginners] Neural network super introduction that can be understood even by cats
item.description: ![IMG_0489.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/458623/93e891ee-1dc8-fa4e-7bb5-5a1922ffe589.png) Written What is a neural network? a unit? weight? bias? Activation function Overview of NN Summary The goal is to get a general idea of the neural network. I don’t use mathematical formulas, so people who are allergic to mathematics should also check it. #1.What is a neural network? A neural network is something like the one below. When written in English, it is Neural Network, so it is often abbreviated as NN.

item.title: [Python] Causal reasoning using machine learning (arrangement of causal reasoning methods)
item.description: # Causal reasoning using machine learning A rough understanding and notes of when to use causal reasoning using machine learning methods that have been actively used in recent years (Memorandum) Basically, the current causal reasoning method is summarized as a flow chart. Introduction Causal reasoning is a series of statistical methods aimed at answering the cause of an outcome. Generally, statistical approaches such as regression analysis focus on quantifying how changes in X are related to changes in Y.

item.title: [Python] Summary of Markov chain and Monte Carlo method
item.description: #Introduction Currently, I am learning about Bayesian statistics. From that, I will summarize the Markov chain Monte Carlo method. In this article, I will explain the outline of Markov chain and Monte Carlo method as an entrance. Next article Here is the book that I referred to this time. Bayes statistics from the basics: a practical introduction to the Hamiltonian Monte Carlo method What is Markov chain Monte Carlo In Bayesian inference, when the observed data is $X$ and the set of unobserved variables such as parameters and latent variables is $Z$, consider the probabilistic model $P(X,Z)$.

item.title: [Python] [Implementation explanation] How to use Japanese version BERT in Google Colaboratory (PyTorch)
item.description: In this article, I will explain how to use the Japanese version of BERT with Google Colaboratory. About the BERT itself, the book I wrote last year “Learn while making! Development deep learning with PyTorch” Is explained in detail in. If you want to know how BERT works, please see the above book. Since the book only dealt with the English version, this post will explain how to use BERT in the Japanese version.

item.title: [Python] Differences that C# engineers felt when they first learned python
item.description: Hi, this is [Muscle Training Clinical Engineering Engineer ken](https://twitter.com/ce_fitness_note). This is my first post on Qiita. I usually use C# to develop medical systems. I decided to focus on machine learning, so I started learning python. Even though I learned about it, I went around Progate’s python course, but I will briefly summarize the differences between C# and how to write. If you usually use C#, C++, VB and want to learn python from now on, I think that learning will be better if you know the difference between the two in advance.

item.title: [Python] Data analysis started with python (data preprocessing-machine learning)

This time, I will apply PyCaret to the Titanic survival prediction problem, submit the prediction result to Kaggle, and see the result. **This is a follow-up article to I tried to classify wine quality with PyCaret, which I posted last time.

item.title: [Python] For those who want to start machine learning with TensorFlow2
item.description: #Introduction I am currently a M2 student majoring in CS. I usually write machine learning code in PyTorch. It’s easy to write for the time being. PyTorch is said to be “Define by Run”**, and what is good at the same time when the calculation graph and data are sent is that it is easy to debug because you can check the calculation results on the way. As a PyTorch believer, I need to write code in TensorFlow this time, so I will keep a memo so that I don’t forget the know-how at that time.

item.title: [Python] Stock Price Prediction by Machine Learning Numerai
item.description: #Introduction The general public may not have heard about it, but there is a hedge fund called “Numerai”. It is a hedge fund that has been known a little in the neighborhood by being covered by media such as Wired and Forbes from the latter half of 2016 to the first half of 2017. This hedge fund is a so-called crowdsourcing type fund that operates based on the forecast results of stock prices by an unspecified number of people.

item.title: [Python] Try the latest physics-based renderer Mitsuba2 (3) Differentiable rendering

item.title: [Python] Machine learning algorithms (support vector machines)
item.description: #Introduction Step-by-step about the theory, the implementation in python, and the analysis using scikit-learn of the algorithm taken up in “Classification of machine learning” Learn with. I wrote it for personal learning, so I would like you to take a look at any mistakes. This time about Support Vector Machine. Despite its old history, it is a popular technique in the field of machine learning. It has a high generalization performance, and was the strongest algorithm until it was broken into deep learning by ILSVRC2012.

item.title: [Python] [With Japanese model] Sentence vector model recommended for people who will process natural language in 2020
item.description: ## Summary Create and publish a Japanese model of Sentence-BERT (Papers,Implementation). did. By using this Japanese model, anyone can easily create high-quality sentence vectors. Please use it. Sentence-BERT uses pre-trained BERTmodelandSiameseNetwork , Is a method of creating a highly accurate sentence vector. Cosine similarity using accuracy evaluation of English version (STSbenchmarkandrankcorrelationcoefficientofspearmanofcorrectlabel.1Inthecaseof(closerisbetter),themethodusingtheaverageofsimplewordvectors(GloVe)is0.58,andthemodelcorrespondingtothescalecreatedthistimeisaround0.85(PapersSeeTable2). The accuracy is 0.17 when using the CLS vector of the bare BERT and 0.46 when using the average of the BERT embeddings, which is worse than the result of the average of the word vector (0.

item.title: [Python] I tried using PIFu that generates a 3D model of a person from one image
item.description: What is #PIFu Image quote (left): Sumire Uesaka Official Blog Nekomori Meeting PIFu: Pixel-Aligned Implicit Function for High-Resolution Clothed Human Digitization If you explain roughly, A machine learning model that generates a 3D model of a person with clothes from a single image is. We introduce Pixel-aligned Implicit Function (PIFu), a highly effective implicit representation that locally aligns pixels of 2D images with the global context of their corresponding 3D object.

item.title: [Python] [Python] Article that enables high-speed sparse matrix calculation
item.description: #Introduction **A sparse matrix is a matrix in which most of the elements of the matrix are 0. It is used in a wide range of fields such as numerical calculation, machine learning, and graph theory (I think). Since most of the matrix is 0, if you devise to ignore 0, you can perform matrix calculation at high speed. For example, if you use a large-scale sparse matrix (nearly 90% is 0) (1 million rows x 1 million columns) and only use non-zero parts, the calculation time will be about 1/10 and the calculation can be completed quickly.

item.title: [Python] Challenges for large-scale models such as BERT

In the field of machine learning where open source and free exchange of information are important, new ideas are published as papers at arxiv.org, and models are shared on github. Doing is the basic way. As soon as new ideas are published, they can be referenced and reused by machine learning researchers and development teams around the world.

item.title: [Python] I want to understand (engineering) UMAP, which is stronger than t-SNE
item.description: Do you know UMAP? I know If you’ve heard it but don’t know it, this article will help you understand it. #What is UMAP It is a method to reduce and visualize dimensions faster and with higher performance than t-SNE. Compare with the commonly used t-SNE. The following figure is a visualization of Fashion MNIST. (From Understanding UMAP) Compared to t-SNE, UMAP seems to have distinct clusters. Similar categories are placed near each other and dissimilar categories are placed far away.

Probably because it is financial related, I can not find any information even if I search … So, my research this year “Acquisition of investment strategy by deep reinforcement learning” I’d like to write about it and be helpful for someone somewhere.

It is known that there are many people who have Melville draw their favorite characters, etc. and use it as a thumbnail for twitter, and it has gained great support. The icon drawn by this person is often called “Mel icon” due to its unique style. Examples of typical Mel icons (Those of Yukatayu and Shun, respectively.

item.title: [Python] I shot Kamehameha using OpenPose
item.description: #Introduction I wanted to shoot Kamehameha so I made it. You can also hide the estimation line. The coordinates of the joint are acquired using OpenPose, the angle is calculated from that, and it is judged whether the pose looks like that. About OpenPose How to set up I used tf pose estimation which is Tensorflow version of OpenPose. My environment was Windows10, GTX1070, etc., so I referred to the following page for setup.

item.title: [Python] [Dimension curse] Can the number of sensors be changed to ∞ to detect anomalies?
item.description: Since the IOT became popular, efforts have been made to increase the number of sensors in order to predictively maintain machinery. Is being done. Rumor has it that there are cases where 100 sensors are attached to one machine. The question is, is it justified to increase the number of sensors? In other words, does **adding extra sensors not affect the anomaly detection performance? When That is it. In this paper, we focus on the curse of dimension, “When we increase the number of extra sensors, we detect anomalies.

item.title: [Python] Why Deep Metric Learning based on the Softmax function works
item.description: #Introduction In distance learning (metric learning) using deep learning, similarities (and dissimilarities) between images are used by using Contrastive Loss and Triplet Loss.) Is widely used, but it is also known that it is difficult to combine and select learning data, and learning itself is difficult in many cases. For that reason, various improvements and ideas have been proposed so far. However, recently, metric learning, which can learn based on the Softmax function as if it is a general class classification task without the difficulty of selecting learning data like this, has been attracting attention.

item.title: [Python] [Machine learning] Understand logistic regression from both scikit-learn and mathematics
item.description: #1. Purpose If you want to do machine learning, anyone can use scikit-learn etc. to implement it relatively easily. However, in order to achieve results at work or to improve your level, The explanation “I don’t really understand the background, but I got this result” is clearly weak. In this article, the two aims are to “use the scikit-learn first because the theory is good” and to “understand the background from mathematics” from the fourth and later.

item.title: [Python] There are many books on machine learning, but which should I buy? Recommended by level! ! <For beginners>
item.description: #Introduction There are many books on machine learning, but I recommend you to buy one by level. There are 5 levels from Level 1 to Level 5. Please choose a book from the level that suits you. It will be best if you read the books introduced here in 3 to 4 months. I don’t cover studying methods in this note, but there are some very good online courses, such as Cousera’s machine learning courses, so please try using services other than books.

item.title: [Python] 40-year-old engineer manager passed Deep Learning for ENGINEER
item.description: ## What is Deep Learning for ENGINEER Please note that this article is current as of January 2020. Currently, the following official qualifications are available to prove AI skills in Japan. JDLA Deep Learning for GENERAL (G test) JDLA Deep Learning for ENGINEER (E qualification) is. Positioned as a test, the G test asks general education about AI-related technology. E-qualification is an exam that understands the theory of AI-related technology and asks the skills to implement AI.

item.title: [Python] Learning Graph Convolutional Networks with PyTorch

item.title: [Python] Machine learning with Pokemon
item.description: ## Introduction The Pokemon Sword Shield was launched last month. By the way, have you ever played Pokemon? As anyone who has played Pokemon will know, Pokemon has the ability value which consists of HP, Kogeki, Bogyo, Tokukou, Tokubo, and Quickness. It can be said that the higher the ability value is, the stronger the Pokemon is. Ability score is calculated from three values: race value, individual value and effort value.

The chapters are as follows. What is the difference between AI development and machine learning? Overview of AI development Where to use machine learning in AI development? Steps to build the model What is machine learning? If you feel that your understanding of is suspicious, you should read “Part 1: Understanding the Purpose of Machine Learning”.

item.title: [Python] I tried to summarize the basic form of GPLVM
item.description: This article is from [Furukawa Lab, Advent_calendar Day 23](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/flab). #Introduction GPLVM is an unsupervised learning method that uses Gaussian process (GP) and can estimate low-dimensional manifolds whose data are distributed in high-dimensional space. The main attraction of GPLVM is that the model is very simple and highly expandable, and theoretically easy to handle. In fact, it has been extended to more complex situations such as Bayesian estimation of hyperparameters, time series data analysis 1, multiview analysis 2, and tensor decomposition 3.

item.title: [Python] For those who look at the log while learning with machine learning ~ Muscle training with LightGBM ~
item.description: What do you guys do when learning models with machine learning? Did you just look at the log output to the console? “Oh, it was lower than I expected!” “Oh, the accuracy is getting worse, do your best!!” It’s surprisingly fun to think, though. But when I cheered up, the model doesn’t do its best, and there is no dramatic development, so it’s a waste of time to look at it.

item.title: [Python] I made a muscle training estimation application using Qore SDK
item.description: ## tl;dr I made a muscle training estimation app Qore uses an algorithm called reservoir computing Performed a task of classifying time series data from acceleration data that can be acquired with a smartphone -Code Pretty good -99.6% accuracy with test data This should make you a muscle engineer Strategy Collect accelerometer data with a smartphone (iphone) Time series data with three components on the x, y and z axes is available Learn with 4 types of muscle training: push-ups, abs, squats, abs You can tell what kind of muscle training you did with only your smartphone Data collection Do your muscle workout with your smartphone in your pants pocket -This time, in any muscle training, put the smartphone in the pocket in the same direction -It seems that it will be more difficult to estimate if it is set in a different direction

item.title: [Python] Recommended learning order for beginners of machine learning and deep learning
item.description: # Target of this article Purpose of writing the article The words AI and deep learning have been around for a long time, but I don’t think there are many people who really understand their meaning. I think it’s very dangerous to have a debate about what AI can do, as in Japan today. I think the reason why there is such a debate about AI in this way is that you do not fully understand the mathematical basis of machine learning.

item.title: [Python] Use Kaggle API inside Docker container
item.description: # things to do Start container using Kaggle official image (kaggle/python) Download csv file with kaggle ~ command Download public notebook with kaggle ~ command First summary DL kaggle.json (kaggle.com >My Account >Create New API Token button) 2.$ docker run -it --rm --mount type=bind,src=pwd,dst=/root/dev kaggle/python $ pip install kaggle $ mkdir ~/.kaggle $ cp /root/dev/kaggle.json ~/.kaggle 6.$ chmod 600 ~/.kaggle/kaggle.json $ kaggle competitions download -c titanic -p input/titanic $ unzip input/titanic/titanic.

item.title: [Python] I don't want to search for high para because it is IQ1 (how to use lightgbm_tuner)
item.description: This article is posted on [IQ1's 2nd Advent Calendar 2019](https://adventar.org/calendars/4711). IQ1 machine learning For machine learning, data preprocessing and model hyper search are inevitable. However, I have an IQ of 1, so I don’t want to do it if I can do preprocessing of data and high-para search. If you put the preprocessing of data into this modern gradient boosting tree system algorithm (such as lightgbm), you can handle the missing values as they are and you do not have to preprocess the categorical variables, so it will be a world relatively friendly to IQ1.

item.title: [Python] Speech recognition by Python MFCC
item.description: In the [previous article](https://qiita.com/k-maru/items/4f12fd0f8344b9e093bd),vowelrecognitionwasperformedusingformantanalysis.IlearnedaboutMFCCinaninternshipat[CyceedCo.,Ltd.](http://www.sciseed.jp/), and verified the classification accuracy, so this article is a continuation of the previous article about MFCC that is often used for speech recognition. I would like to summarize. ##table of contents Background What is MFCC -MFCC derivation process Implementation of MFCC derivation program -Regarding librosa -Derivation of MFCC -Phoneme class classification using MFCC Implementation of a program for continuous speech recognition -Regarding dynamic differences -Derivation of primary and secondary differences -Phoneme class classification including features of second-order differences Consideration Summary Reference background Previous article formant analysis finds the envelope of the spectrum, and the frequencies emphasized in them are used as features from lower to F1 and F2.

item.title: [Python] Smoother pipeline processing in Luigi! Introducing gokart
item.description: # what is this? This is a summary article about gokart, a wrapper library for Luigi. The motivation for development and basic usage are summarized in M3’s blog very carefully, and the basic usage is It’s a story that I should read this, but I wanted to summarize it as a reverse lookup reference, so I made an article. The functions of Luigi itself are not explained so much.

item.title: [Python] Score-CAM implementation with keras. Comparison with Grad-CAM
item.description: # Overview Implemented the method “Score-CAM” of Paper posted on arxiv on October 3, 2019 with keras. Comparison with Grad-CAM, Grad-CAM++. Implemented the independently accelerated Faster Score-CAM. Applied to the model trained on DAGM dataset. The code can be found on github. What is # Score-CAM? One of the visualization methods of the basis of judgment of CNN -There is a wonderful summary on here for understanding the judgment basis.

item.title: [Python] Gaussian process and machine learning Gaussian process regression implemented only by numpy of Python
item.description: I recently read ["Gaussian Process and Machine Learning"](https://www.amazon.co.jp/GaussianProcessandMachineLearning-MachineLearningProfessionalSeries-Mochihashi-Daichi/dp/4061529269) I implemented it. The content is “3.4.2 Gaussian Process Regression Calculation” in Chapter 3. Deer is a landmark. It is easy to understand and highly recommended. What is the Gauss process? First of all, to explain the Gaussian process in one word, At Y=f(X) “If input X is similar, output Y is similar." It is a tool for mathematically expressing that property.

item.title: [Python] What an amateur stumbled upon in Deep Learning made from scratch Memo: Chapter 1
item.description: #Introduction Suddenly, I thought “[Deep Learning from scratch-the theory and implementation of deep learning learned with Python]” (https://www.oreilly.co.jp/books/9784873117584/) and “Deep Learning from scratch ( 2)-Natural language processing” I decided to study. However, I am very worried whether I will not be able to take the time to continue. However, when I completed [Language Processing 100 Knock 2015]2-3yearsago,Amateurlanguageprocessing100knocks I continued to post to Qiita, and thanks to everyone’s likes and comments, I was able to finish it, so again this time Qiita’s I decided to help.

item.title: [Python] (Saved version: updated from time to time) A collection of useful tutorials for doing data analysis hackathons by Team AI
item.description: We at Team AI hold machine learning study sessions and data analysis hackathons every day in Shibuya. The goal is to have a community of 1 million people, mainly in Tokyo. I hope this movement of data analysis will spread throughout Japan and around the world. We have put together a useful tutorial for doing data analysis hackathons. It’s a lot of fun, so everyone, especially the locals, should try it out for yourself!

item.title: [Python] Environment construction of auto-sklearn that semi-automates machine learning (Mac&Docker)
item.description: What is # auto-sklearn A library that can semi-automatically perform preprocessing of machine learning, algorithm selection, and hyperparameter search. See below for detailed explanation. What is auto-sklearn? Automatic machine learning with WPython auto sklearn Data analysis with Python: Automation of machine learning Build an environment for auto-sklearn on mac As a premise, auto-sklearn is developed on Ubuntu, and it works on Linux but may not work on Mac or Window.

item.title: [Python] [Statistics for programmers] There is more than one way to calculate the average value
item.description: ## table of contents Statistics for Programmers-Table of Contents Related article Average, Median, Mode Overview When calculating the average value, I generally think of adding all the values and dividing by the number of elements. However, there are several other average values, such as weighted average and geometric average, which can be used depending on the application. The commonly known method of dividing the total by the number of elements is called the arithmetic mean.

item.title: [Python] 100 amateur language processing knocks: Summary
item.description: It is a summary of the challenge record of [100 language processing knock 2015](http://www.cl.ecei.tohoku.ac.jp/nlp100/). :warning:** This is not a challenge record of 100 processing of language knock 2020.Theold2015version is the target. Please note: bangbang:** Challenge environment Ubuntu 16.04 LTS + Python 3.5.2 :: Anaconda 4.1.1 (64-bit). (Only Problem 00andProblem01arePython2.7.) #Chapter 1: Preparatory exercise Reviewing somewhat advanced programming language topics while working on materials that deal with text and strings.

item.title: [Python] [Translation] scikit-learn 0.18 User Guide 4.1. Pipeline and Feature Union: Combination of estimators
item.description: Google translated http://scikit-learn.org/0.18/modules/pipeline.html scikit-learn 0.18 User Guide 4. Dataset conversion 4.1. Pipeline and FeatureUnion: Estimator combination 4.1.1. Pipeline: Chain estimation Pipeline can be used to combine multiple estimators into one. I can do it. It is convenient because the steps that process the data, such as feature selection, normalization, and classification, are often fixed. The pipeline serves two purposes here. -Convenience: To fit the whole sequence of estimators, just call fit and predict the data once.

item.title: [Python] From environment construction to deep learning tutorial
[Python] Understand the TensorFlow namespace and master shared variables
item.description: ## Intro This is the 9th day article of TensorFlow Advent Calendar 2016. TensorFlow was released in November 2015, but the “namespace” function was supported from the beginning. This is used in graph visualization with TensorBoard, but of course it’s not the only one. Namespaces are very useful for managing identifiers. I recall C++ when it comes to strong “namespace” support, but I’ll quote it from a C++ instruction book (self-study C++).

item.title: [Python] Implemented PRML algorithm in Python (almost Numpy only)
item.description: I will implement the method published in PRML in Python for my own study (machine learning algorithm and Python study). As a general rule, in the algorithm part, in addition to the Python standard library, Only Numpy can be used. Machine learning packages such as scikit-learn and tensorflow are not used. Packages that show results such as matplotlib will be used unless they are related to the implementation of the algorithm.

item.title: [Python] Predict the value of the water level gauge by machine learning using open data of data city Sabae
item.description: #Introduction When I was looking for something good as an example of using open data, I found that the water level data was published on the site of Data City Sabae, so I tried machine learning using it. It was http://data.city.sabae.lg.jp/top_page/ Download data There is the following notation in the “Disaster prevention” group on the “Open data” page on the above site. Water level data (Sabae City, Fukui Prefecture) Nontegawa Drainage Pump Station [CSV] It is the data of the water level gauge in Sabae city.

item.title: [Python] Talk to improve the bottleneck of machine learning algorithm with Cython
item.description: #About this article Talk about how to make Python faster Find CPU bound processing bottlenecks by profiling Improve the bottleneck you find with Cython #Introduction We recently implemented a recommendation algorithm called Bayesian Personalized Ranking (BPR). I tried to write the code with reference to the formula of this paper, but when I tried to execute it, it was a bit too slow and I could not use it, so I improved the processing speed.

item.title: [Python] Deep Learning (under attendance)
item.description: Taking classes at MPS Yokohama I am having a difficult time because I am a beginner in programming and mathematics. (We will check Markdown notation and TeX notation and rewrite later) Motivation for attending: Ultimately, I want to customize the appropriate Deep Learning library (tensorflow) etc. and use it for work (advertisement operation tool) and play (home electronics operation from sensing??). Textbook (learning source) MPS lecture slides Lecture video

item.title: [Python] How to make face image data set used in machine learning (2: Frame analysis of moving image and acquisition of candidate image)
item.description: [Last time](http://qiita.com/ligerbolt/items/aeaa88980030fba940b6) introduced how to collect candidate images using Bing Image Search API. This time, I will introduce a method of frame analysis and collection of videos. Development environment used this time MacOS X El Capitan 10.11.4 Python 3.5 OpenCV 3.1 Merits of extracting candidate images from videos The video basically uses the same mechanism as flipbook comics, and still images are switched within a short time to express movement.

item.title: [Python] Machine learning beginners try out Naive Bayes (1)-theory
item.description: ## This page Since I’m a machine learning beginner and a Python beginner, I think that it will be a bit like reading the pages that were basically referenced. What is conditional probability (Bayes’ theorem)? ? It’s a bit of math. Have you heard the term conditional probability? I heard a little about it in the class before, but I didn’t remember much. P(B|A) = \frac{P(A \cap B)}{P(A)} = \frac{P(B)P(A|B)}{P(A)} P(B|A) is the probability of event B occurring when event A occurs.

item.title: [Python] Introduction to Machine Learning from Simple Perceptron
item.description: #1. What is a simple perceptron? The input data is classified into two classes using the following linear discriminant function. f(x)=g(w^{T}x+\theta)\\ Here, if \theta = x_0, \\ =g(\sum _{i=0}^{d}w_ix_i) Non-linear activation function: g(a) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} +1 & (a \geq 0) \\ - 1 & (a \lt 0) \end{array} \right. Weight: w=(w_0,w_1,...,w_{d}), \\ Input data: x=(x_0=\theta,x_1,x_2,...,x_{d}), \\d: number of dimensions, Bias: \theta (arbitrary number) When f(x) \geq 0, x\in C_{1} When f(x) \lt 0, x\in C_{2} C_1: Class 1, C_2: Class 2 Of the above, the process for determining the parameter of weight_w_ is called “learning”.

item.title: [Python] TensorFlow Deep MNIST for Experts 翻訳
item.description: #Introduction Beforeandprevious using Beginner tutorial translation and actually using TensorFlow I did machine learning. This time I translated the tutorial for Expert. Deep MNIST for Experts TensorFlow is a powerful library for performing large-scale numerical calculations. One of the best tasks is the training and execution of deep neural networks. In this tutorial we will learn the basic building blocks of a TensorFlow model while building a deep convolutional MNIST classifier.

item.title: [Python] I tried to compress the image using machine learning
item.description: ![original_compressed.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.amazonaws.com/0/77079/2f7e9fc7-d91a-bd40-dca9-bed85174e317.png) #Introduction Try compressing the image using K-Means, which is a typical clustering algorithm. First, I will explain the K-Means algorithm. After that, I will explain about image compression using K-Means. For details, refer to Coursera Machine Learning. What is clustering? Dividing a collection of data into several groups (clusters) according to the similarity between the data. K-Means algorithm Intuitive description of algorithm The K-Means algorithm is roughly divided into the following three processes:

The following translations are inadequate as translations, and their comparison with related python libraries is somewhat unique. OpenCV-Python Tutorials of OpenCV 3.2 http://docs.opencv.org/3.2.0/d9/df8/tutorial_root.html It is published in. (The accuracy of Google Translate has improved recently, so it may be enough to try Google Translate rather than reading this article.

item.title: [Python] I tried to classify the voice actor's voice
item.description: I tried to identify the voice actor's voice in machine learning practice. Make a note of the procedure. ###Thing you want to do First of all, let’s learn the voice actors’ original voices (voices such as radio), and check how accurately they can be identified by including the original voices as test data. Next, I would like to test whether the voices of anime can be predicted from the voice actors’ original voices.

item.title: [Python] I tried to build an environment for machine learning with Python (Mac OS X)
item.description: At the CROSS 2015 python session the other day, I thought that machine learning might be interesting, so for the time being, I tried to prepare the environment, so it is also a meme. The article of CROSS 2015 the other day is here. :black_square_button: Overview Build an environment for machine learning with python I didn’t do a big deal, so I thought I shouldn’t give it to Qiita, but I was addicted to various things, so I will give it for the time being.

item.title: [Python] Tool to support machine learning in Python MALSS (Introduction)
item.description: <Font color="red">Support Python3 (2016.01.25)</font> I made a tool called MALSS (Machine Learning Support System) that supports machine learning in Python (PyPI/GitHub). We would be happy if you could give us your opinions. I’m writing the rest here. Tool MALSS (basic) that supports machine learning in Python Tool MALSS (application) that supports machine learning in Python Purpose A rich open source development environment has made it really easy to use machine learning.

item.title: [Python] Calculation of support vector machine (SVM) (using cvxopt)
item.description: Hello. The calculation of the support vector machine (SVM) is based on the procedure (using cvxopt) of Discontinuation creation “soft margin SVM” about artificial intelligenceIfyoufollowitexactly,youwillfeelalittlelikecalculatingthesolutionyourself.Inthefollowing1,theconvergentsolutionofLagrangemultiplieralpha,tabplot,etc.arealsoplotted(```class×prediction==1``Highlightthedatathatbecomes`.prediction==0istheboundaryline). $ ./svm.py file = classification.txt (len=200) cvxopt result status: optimal delta = 5.684342e-14 class = ('-1','+1') confusion matrix: [[96 7] [34 63]] #!/usr/bin/env python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # support vector machine (SVM) calculation Use # cvxopt.solvers.qp (Quadratic Programming) from __future__ import print_function import numpy as np import cvxopt Ccoeff = [30, 30] # soft margin coefficients of class SIGMA = 1.

item.title: [Python] Calculate tf-idf with scikit-learn
item.description: **This post is the fourth day article of [Reality Escape Advent Calendar 2013](http://katryo.hatenablog.com/entry/2013/12/19/001823). ** 2nd dayusesthehtmlfetchedusingtheBingAPI,so[2ndday](http://qiita.com/katryo(/items/62291ba328de9d12bd30) is easier to understand if you read it first. Put this article in 3 lines I checked a Python library called scikit-learn Day 2 Calculated tf-idf of word in html saved Confirmed word to tfidf mapping Reference scikit-learn formula, text feature extraction document Calculating tfidf of words in Tweet using scikit-learn
